name: Expos√© feedback configuration
description: the configuration of grading criteria for LLMentor

rubrics.name: Overall
rubrics.description: Overall assessment criteria for feedback quality

scoring.description: No summary available or does not reflect understanding of the performance
Simple summary, demonstrates basic understanding of the performance
Concise and accurate summary that clearly reflects understanding of performance and builds confidence in feedback

criteria.name: Clarity
criteria.description: Clarity with regard to the overall structure

scoring.description: Feedback needs considerable improvement in clarity and comprehensibility, comments are disjointed or difficult to follow
Feedback is largely clear, but sometimes lacks specific references to particular lines, pages, sections or figures/tables
Feedback is clear, well-structured and easy to understand, with coherent comments and precise references to specific points in the text
Many linguistic errors (e.g. wrong tense, wrong personal pronouns)
Almost no linguistic errors, clear and comprehensible sentences with standardised terminology
The tone is inappropriate, sounds judgemental or reproachful, criticism comes across as destructive or personal
The tone is generally respectful, avoids personal attacks, but remains unclear or less friendly in places
The tone is consistently calm, respectful and polite; criticism is constructive, factual and only directed at the text, not the person

rubrics.name: Feed Up
rubrics.description: Assessment of goal setting and success criteria

scoring.description: No learning objectives, unclear what is to be achieved, no orientation
Partly unclear learning objectives, generally formulated, offer only limited orientation
Clear learning objectives, specific, challenging, comparable and provide clear direction
No success criteria, success unclear or vaguely formulated, objectives not defined
Partly unclear success criteria, available but imprecise or general, orientation partly missing
Clear success criteria, concrete, measurable goals and clear definition of success

rubrics.name: Feed Back
rubrics.description: Assessment of feedback quality and knowledge transfer

scoring.description: No information as to whether the task has been solved or not
Information given as to whether the task has been solved or not
No information on the correct answer
Correct answer is clearly communicated
No information on rules, requirements or restrictions of the task
Clear information on rules, requirements or restrictions of the task (e.g. specifications)
No information on conceptual knowledge
Basic information on relevant concepts is provided
No information about errors
Information on the number, location, source or type of errors

criteria.name: Self-feedback
criteria.description: Self Feedback (e.g. praise or recognition) not available or only in combination with learning strategies or self-regulation

scoring.description: Self-feedback is available that has not been combined with task, process or self-regulation (including feedback on the learner's abilities (i.e. intelligence or talent))
No self-feedback is available or, if available, in combination with task, process or self-regulation

criteria.name: Self-regulation
criteria.description: Knowledge about how to process the task or about self regulation

scoring.description: No indication of how to approach the task, no recognisable approaches to self-monitoring or self-assessment

Either indications of strategies for working on the task and recognising errors (e.g. suggestions for improvement, targeted search for information) or approaches to self-monitoring and self-assessment (e.g. reflection on own understanding, strategies or willingness to seek help)
No information on how to develop or improve learning skills
Information on how to improve the learning objective and how to deal with challenges

rubrics.name: Content Quality
rubrics.description: Assessment of content accuracy and usefulness

scoring.description: The content has significant deficiencies in terms of correctness
The content is largely correct
The content is completely correct
No specific instructions available, feedback is difficult to implement
Some instructions available, but only partially clear or specific

Clear, specific feedback with actionable instructions, e.g. comparisons with existing methods, application to other tasks, definitions, explanations, discussions, additional analyses or specific suggestions to remove confusion
Statements or conclusions are not supported by evidence or comprehensible explanations. The argumentation remains superficial or unsystematic, making the content unconvincing.
Statements are supported by comprehensible evidence, examples or explanations. The argumentation shows a clear link between evidence and conclusions, which strengthens the quality of the content.

rubrics.name: Errors
rubrics.description: Assessment of potential errors and issues in feedback

scoring.description: All important details have been considered and no unnecessary questions are asked
Important details have been overlooked, leading to unnecessary questions or criticism
Criticism is specific and clearly states what is missing or can be improved
Unspecific criticism, mentions missing components without clearly stating what is missing
Proposals remain within the scope of the task and are relevant
Suggestions refer to methods or analyses that go beyond the intended scope
Alternative methods, etc. (if available) are supported with justification or references
Alternative methods, etc. (if available) are suggested without justification or references
Feedback is consistent in itself, no contradictory statements
Contradictory feedback, e.g. criticism and praise for the same methods
